abstract.text: A type that describes the configuration of an app’s schema or specific group of models.

abstract.text: Write your model code declaratively to add managed persistence and efficient
model fetching.
A type that describes the configuration of an app’s schema or specific group of models.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.
A type that describes the options for detecting a CloudKit database.
A type that describes the options for detecting an app group container.
A type representing the stable identity of the entity associated with
an instance.
A Boolean value that determines whether the associated persistent storage is
writable.
The identifier of the configuration’s CloudKit database container.
The option to use when detecting the container of the preferred CloudKit
database.
The identifier of the configuration’s app group container.
The option to use when detecting the preferred app group container.
Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the
given hasher.
The hash value.
The stable identity of the entity associated with this instance.
Creates a named model configuration for the specified schema.
Creates a named model configuration that specifies the on-disk location of the
schema’s persistent storage.
Creates a model configuration for the specified model types.
Creates a basic model configuration.
A Boolean value that determines whether the associated persistent storage is
ephemeral and exists only in memory.
The model configuration’s name.
The schema that maps model classes to the associated data in the persistent
storage.
The on-disk location of the schema’s persistent storage.
Creates a model container using the specified schema, migration plan, and
configurations.
Creates a model container using the specified model types, migration plan, and
zero or more configurations.
Creates a model container using the specified schema, migration plan, and zero
or more configurations.
An interface that enables SwiftData to manage a Swift class as a stored model.
Describe your model classes to SwiftData using the framework’s macros, and
store instances of those models so they exist beyond the app’s runtime.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Preserving your app’s model data across launches

abstract.text: An object that maps model classes to data in the model store, and helps with the migration of that data
between releases.
An interface for describing the evolution of a schema and how to migrate between specific versions.
Add the required capabilities and define a compatible schema to enable
SwiftData to automatically sync your app’s model data using iCloud.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Syncing model data across a person’s devices

abstract.text: A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.

topicSections.title: Sharing and syncing the model store
